issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Can't seem to get apps running in the simulator nor on iOS devices after TiSDK  3.4.0-rc4 Update

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.environment: Mac Book Yosemite Beta 10.10, IOS SDK 8.0 Simulator 8.0 Titanium SDK 3.4

comments.body:
I am getting an exact issue as well :(  

Any help?

Hi all,

You have to update the studio , CLI to 3.4.0 as well. 
Here is the ref: [http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2014/09/announcing-our-ios-8-support-with-appcelerator-sdkstudio-3-4-0-release/]
Hope this will help you.

Regards,
Shuo

I have installed the new version, now am getting this error:

/usr/local/lib/node_modules/titanium/node_modules/longjohn/dist/longjohn.js:185
        throw e;
              ^
Error: EACCES, permission denied '/Users/carfernandez/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.4.0.v20140922135716/android/package.json'
    at fs.openSync (fs.js:427:18)
    at fs.readFileSync (fs.js:284:15)
    at Module._extensions..json (module.js:480:44)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Module._load (module.js:312:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:364:17)
    at require (module.js:380:17)
    at findPackageJson (/Users/carfernandez/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.4.0.v20140922135716/node_modules/titanium-sdk/lib/android.js:50:25)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/carfernandez/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.4.0.v20140922135716/node_modules/titanium-sdk/lib/android.js:55:2)
    at Module._compile (module.js:456:26)
---------------------------------------------
    at Object.run (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/titanium/node_modules/node-appc/lib/subprocess.js:59:8)
    at find (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/titanium/node_modules/node-appc/lib/subprocess.js:96:14)
    at q.process (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:731:21)
    at processImmediate (timers.js:330:15)


Still cannot run a project :(

One thing I ended up doing was to downgrade everything: 
1.Uninstalled Titanium Studio (completely from my system) and then went and got a new installation.
2.Uninstalled Xcode 6 and went and got 5.1 (previous version) and everything worked again.

I know that's not going to solve your problem if you really want to use Xcode6 and the Titaniums SDK 3.4.X, but in my case it wasn't worth the effort of trying to make it work if I couldn't even get my development environment to work.

Good luck!

Hi Carlos,

Looks like you don't have permission to read some files, Any chance to move that user to be administrator?
Hope this will help you. 

Regards,
Shuo

The issue has not been resolved, I still not able to use Tatinium Studio.   I am now running Yosemite 10.10.  

I get the following error:  An internal error occurred during: "Computing SDK Info...".
java.lang.NullPointerException
